title: Assignee for creditors, instructions, and approval of accounts
context: §554-7 Assignee for creditors, instructions, and approval of accounts. A trustee or assignee for creditors has the same right, by application to a circuit court to request and receive instructions or to have the trustee&rsquo;s or assignee&rsquo;s accounts approved or be discharged from the trustee&rsquo;s or assignee&rsquo;s trust, as any other fiduciary, according to the usages and principles of courts of equity concerning trusts. [L 1941, c 292, §1; RL 1945, §12577; RL 1955, §340-7; HRS §554-7; am L 1972, c 145, §3(d); gen ch 1985] Rules of Court Accountings, see Hawaii Probate Rules, part A(VII); HPR rules 83, 84. Case Notes See 36 H. 732.
